[[peer-to-peer file sharing]] [[Proprietary software]] [http://www.bearshare.com/ BearShare.com] BearShareis apeer-to-peer file sharingapplication originally created by Free Peers, Inc. forMicrosoft Windowsand also a rebranded version ofiMeshby MusicLab, LLC, tightly integrated with their music subscription service.
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: The principal operators of Free Peers, Inc. were Vincent Falco and Louis Tatta.cite webhttp://www.slyck.com/news.php?storyBearShare HistorySlyck.com2012-10-16Bearshare was launched on December 4, 2000 as aGnutella-based peer-to-peer file sharing application with innovative features that eventually grew to include IRC chat, a free library of software and media called BearShare Featured Artists, online help pages and a support forum integrated as dedicated web browser windows in the application; as well as a media player and a library window to organize the user's media collection.cite webArchive of BearShare's User Guide.https://technutopia.com/bearshare/help/userguide.htmBearShare Online Help18 October 2012Joel Young

Following the June 27, 2005Supreme Court of the United StatesUnited States Supreme Courtdecision on theMGM Studios, Inc. v. Grokster, Ltd.case the BearShare Community support forums were abruptly closed during negotiations to settle an impending lawsuit with theRecording Industry Association of AmericaRIAA.cite webRecord labels send more letters to P2P serviceshttp://news.cnet.com/RIAA-sends-letters-to-P2P-services/2100-1030_3-5867085.html?tagCNET News19 October 2012Dawn KawamotoSeptember 15, 2005cite newsStreamCast Reports Failure of Talks With Film and Music Firmshttp://articles.latimes.com/2006/apr/08/business/fi-stream818 October 2012Los Angeles Times8 April 2006The webmaster and forum administrator immediately created a new site called Technutopia and the same support staff continue to support the gnutella versions from there. A few months later the unused Community window was removed from BearShare 5.1.cite webBearShare 5.1.0 changeloghttp://webpages.charter.net/msw101144/bsx/History.txt19 October 2012

On May 4, 2006, Free Peers agreed to transfer all their BearShare-related assets to MusicLab, LLC (aniMeshsubsidiary) and use the $30 million raised from that sale to settle with the RIAA.cite webhttp://www.slyck.com/forums/viewtopic.php?tBearShare SettlesSlyck.comcite webFile-share firm averts legal movehttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/4976902.stmBBC News18 October 2012

On August 17, 2006, MusicLab released a reskinned and updated version ofiMeshnamed BearSharev6 which connected to its proprietaryiMeshnetwork instead ofgnutella.cite webBearShareV6 Launch Press Releasehttp://www.businesswire.com/portal/site/google/index.jsp?ndmViewIdBusiness Wire18 October 2012BearShareV6 and its successors offer paid music downloads in thePlaysForSureDigital rights managementDRMcontrolledWindows Media AudioWMAformat as well as free content in various formats, chiefly MP3.cite webhttp://www.bearshare.com/helpfiles/html/TypesofMediaContentinBearshare.htmlTypes of Media Content in BearshareBearshare.com2012-10-16Like BearShare they also include a media player and embedded online and social networking features but with a Web 2.0 style, somewhat similar toMySpaceorFacebook.cite webBearShareV10 Features.http://support.bearshare.com/index.php?/News/NewsItem/View/1/the-best-file-sharing-software-just-got-better18 October 2012cite webhttp://www.bearshare.com/helpIM.htmlInstant Messenger QuestionsBearshare.com2012-10-16Free content provided by users is automatically verified usingacoustic fingerprintingas non-infringing before it can be shared. Video files more than 50 Mb in size and 15 minutes in length cannot be shared, ensuring television shows and feature-length movies cannot be distributed over the network. Only a limited set of music and video file types can be shared, thus excluding everything else like executable files, documents and compressed archives.

In August 2006, MusicLab released a variant of the original BearSharegnutellaservant, called BearFlix, which was altered to limit sharing, searches and downloads to images and videos. Shared videos were limited in length and duration, similar to limits in BearShareV6. The first release was version 1.2.1.cite webhttp://www.soft82.com/download/Windows/BearFlixSoft82 release historySoft82.com2012-10-16Its version numbers appear to start from 1.1.2.1 in the user interface but it presents itself on the gnutella network as versions 6.1.2.1 to 6.2.2.530. This version has since been discontinued by MusicLab and no longer available on their websites; however it remains in wide usage.

On October 27, 2008, responding to uncertainty around the future ofPlaysForSure,cite webHutchinsonLeehttp://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20080422-drm-sucks-redux-microsoft-to-nuke-msn-music-drm-keys.htmlDRM sucks redux: Microsoft to nuke MSN Music DRM keysArstechnica.com2008-04-222012-10-16MusicLab addediPodsupport in BearShareV7.
article.heading: Active Versions
article.paragraph: Three variants of the original BearSharegnutellaservant were distributed by Free Peers: Free, Lite and Pro. The Free version had higher performance limits than the Lite version but contained someadware.cite webhttp://www.softpedia.com/reviews/windows/BearShare-Review-14307.shtmlBearShare Review - BearShare DownloadSoftpedia2012-10-16cite webhttp://www.zeropaid.com/bearsharelite/BearShare LiteZeropaid.com2012-10-16The Pro version had higher limits than both the Free and Lite versions but costUnited States dollarUS$24. Version numbers in this series ranged from 1.0 to 5.2.5.9. Though lacking MusicLab's support a wide spread of BearShare versions from 4.7 to 5.2.5.6 remain the second most popular servent on gnutella, alongside LimeWire.

Old-School fans of the gnutella versions tend to favour the last of the beta versions, 5.1.0 beta25,cite webBearShare B25https://technutopia.com/forum/showthread.php?t27 November 2012because it has no adware, is hard-coded for performance levels roughly between Pro and regular [ad-supported] versions and has the unique ability to switch between leaf and ultrapeer mode on demand, a feature deemed necessary for effective testing. No other gnutella servent has enjoyed this capability.

The current MusicLab version, V10, is available by free download from their support websitecite webhttp://support.bearshare.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/3/2/download--installationDownload & Installation | BearShare Supportsupport.bearshare.com2011-11-172012-10-15and "Pro" features can be unlocked with a six or twelve-month subscription. Access to premium content requires a $9.95 monthly subscription. Customers in Canada and the U.S.A. can opt for a $14.95 monthly "BearShare ToGo" subscription which allows downloads of premium music to portable music players.cite webSubscriptionshttp://support.bearshare.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/28/5/free-subscriptionMusicLab18 October 2012
